New Records: Daniel Gafford scored a season-high 18 points
Dallas outscored the Magic 30-9 in the first 9:30 of the second quarter
Dallas outscored Orlando 19-12 in fast-break points
Dallas finished with a season-high 53 rebounds
Key Match Events: The Mavericks outscored the Magic 13-2 in the final 3:10 of the first quarter
Orlando missed its last six field goal attempts, including a full-court heave at the buzzer
Pre-Game Insights: Orlando played its second game without Paolo Banchero, the No. 1 overall pick in the 2022 draft and 2023 Rookie of the Year, who suffered a torn right oblique last Wednesday
Wendell Carter Jr. was limited to nine first-half minutes, six points and a rebound because of a strain of his left plantar fascia
Post-Match Reflections: The Magic scored well below its average of 111.7 points per game
Dallas outscored Orlando 52-36 in the paint and were a season-worst 19.5% on 3-pointers
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dereck Lively II had 11 points and 11 rebounds off Dallasâ€™ bench
Others: The Magic will visit the Thunder on Monday, the same day the Mavericks will host the Pacers and coach Rick Carlisle, who coached Dallas to its lone NBA title in 2011
